title: How To Do Breakfast Gordon Ramsay Style
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
Breakfast getting boring? Sick of eating the same oatmeal and cereal every morning? Then you’ve got to try these Gordon Ramsay-approved breakfast recipes. 

  1. Cajun Style Breakfast Sandwich

Melted cheese, toasted croissant, and hot sauce — who could say no to this breakfast sandwich? Other ingredients you’ll need include one Chino Valley Ranchers pasture raised egg, a few slices of ham, butter, Old Bay seasoning, olive oil, romaine lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise, lemon wedges, and salt.

View the full recipe.

  1. Breakfast Tacos

Don’t wait until Tuesday to have these breakfast tacos. Made with two corn tortillas, for these tacos you’ll need eggs, scallions/green onions, serrano chili, chorizo, bacon, crimini mushroom, shallot, salsa verde, pico de gallo, cotija cheese, cilantro, pickled red onion, butter, and crème fraîche.

View the full recipe.

  1. North African Eggs

Transport your taste buds to North Africa with this fried egg recipe. The ingredients list includes olive oil, onion, red pepper, green pepper, garlic cloves, red chili, cumin seeds, tomatoes, eggs, coriander leaves, spring onion, bread crumbs, sea salt, and black pepper.

View the full recipe.

  1. Creamy Mushroom Toast With Soft Egg & Gruyère

Here’s another ultra fine breakfast toast recipe that will have you dreaming of breakfast at dinner time. Before you start cooking, make sure you have the following ingredients: unsalted butter, olive oil, mushrooms, garlic cloves, thyme, shallot, sherry vinegar, sourdough or country bread, arugula, Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, crème fraîche, and gruyère cheese.

View the full recipe.

  1. Finnish Root Vegetable Hash With Pork Sausages

No need to visit a Finnish grocery store to get vegetables for this recipe. All you need to make this vegetable hash is red onion, pork breakfast sausage, olive oil, potatoes, beets, unsalted butter, salt, black pepper, dill, chives, and Chino Valley Ranchers eggs.

View the full recipe.

Be sure to follow Gordon’s instructions to a tee to get the flavor and texture just right. Happy cooking!
